result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: (NDVA-2000e).The optical properties of the photocatalyst were analyzed using a photoluminescence detector. Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction in the liquid phase is performed in a custom-built glass reactor with a 300 mL volume.Cooling water from a chiller is passed through the jacketed wall of the reactor to control the temperature at 25 1C.A 300 W Xe lamp is used as a light source.First, 0.05 g of photocatalyst is dispersed in 100 mL of deionized water in a glass reactor under magnetic stirring.Before light

magnetic stirring.Before light irradiation, CO 2 gas is brought into the above solution for 10 min to eliminate air and to build up a saturated CO 2 solution.Subsequently, the lamp is turned on to start the photoreaction.During the reaction process, photocatalytic materials were taken from the enclosed light at 1 h intervals.The type and content of the product were measured every 1 h using a gas chromatography (GC-7920, China) detector.The isotope labeling experiment used 13 CO 2 instead of 12 CO 2 , and

therefore CO 2 can be reduced to CO (eqn (4)).The photoinduced holes derived from P-CN can oxidize water to generate O 2 and H 54,55 (eqn (5)).This transfer mechanism is beneficial to inhibit the recombination of photocarriers and improve the photocatalytic performance of P-CNCsPbBr 3 . (GC-MS), and the results are shown in Fig. S6 (ESI ).It is observed that obvious signals appear at mz 29 ( 13 CO) and mz 28 ( 12 CO), which confirms that CO is derived from the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 over P-CNCsPbBr 3 . result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX
